articles.title: GM Temporarily Cuts 5,500 Workers as Trump Policies Pressure EVs
articles.description: General Motors Co. notified about 5,500 employees across three plants that they are being laid off at least temporarily as the carmaker reassesses electric vehicle production in the wake of President Donald Trump’s move to eliminate crucial tax credits.
articles.content: General Motors Co. notified about 5,500 employees across three plants that they are being laid off at least temporarily as the carmaker reassesses electric vehicle production in the wake of President Donald Trump ’s move to eliminate crucial tax cred... [414 chars]

articles.title: There is a silver lining in the White House's East Wing demolition
articles.description: History buff Stewart McLaurin says the East Wing demolition has sparked interest in White House history from the general public.
articles.content:
Stewart McLaurin knew it was coming.
An entire wing of the White House, a building he calls “the most special, important building on the planet,” was going to be replaced to make way for a ballroom that President Donald Trump wants to add to the buil... [4810 chars]

articles.title: US fails to make big dent in UN vote calling for end to Cuba embargo
articles.description: The United Nations General Assembly overwhelmingly called for an end to a U.S. economic embargo on Cuba despite lobbying by Washington that included sharing an accusation that up to 5,000 Cubans are fighting alongside Russian forces in Ukraine.
articles.content: WASHINGTON, Oct 29 (Reuters) - The United Nations General Assembly overwhelmingly called for an end to a U.S. economic embargo on Cuba despite lobbying by Washington that included sharing an accusation that up to 5,000 Cubans are fighting alongside R... [429 chars]

articles.title: GM to cut over 1,200 jobs at EV plant, Detroit News reports
articles.description: General Motors will cut about 1,200 jobs at its EV plant in Detroit, as the automaker responds to slowing demand for its battery cars, Detroit News reported on Wednesday.
articles.content:
The company will also lay off 550 people at its Ultium battery facility in Ohio, while temporarily cutting another 850 jobs, the report said.
Sign up here.
The news comes as GM pares its outlook for EV sales after the slashing of a key federal incent... [480 chars]

articles.title: AG's lawsuit settled by Livingston Parish library board
articles.description: The Livingston Parish library board voted to settle a lawsuit filed by Attorney General Liz Murrill alleging the board violated Open Meetings Law when it ousted the library director in July
articles.content:

articles.title: US issues general license for German assets of Russia's Rosneft, website shows
articles.description: The United States issued a Russia-related general license authorizing transactions involving Rosneft Deutschland GmbH and RN Refining & Marketing GmbH, according to a posting Wednesday on a Treasury Department website.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON, Oct 29 (Reuters) - The United States issued a Russia-related general license authorizing transactions involving Rosneft Deutschland GmbH and RN Refining & Marketing GmbH, according to a posting Wednesday on a Treasury Department website.

articles.title: ‘General Hospital’ and ‘Doctor Who’ actor dead at 84
articles.description: The actor died with his wife by his side.
articles.content:
Longtime actor Tony Adams, who held down legendary roles on such daytime soaps as “Crossroads” and “General Hospital,” as well as a stint on “Dr. Who,” has died.
Adams passed away Saturday at Sussex County Hospital in Brighton, with his wife Christin... [1073 chars]
